com.skayani.brickbreaker.sprites

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skayani.brickbreaker.sprites.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
    Ball class that represents the moving ball on the screen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ball(int x, int y)
      Ball constructor class that takes in an x-coordinate and y-coordinate representing the ball's initial position on the screen.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds velocity to the ball given a Vector2.
      boolean ballOut()
      Checks whether the ball has gone out of bounds.
      boolean collidesHorizontal()
      Checks whether the ball has collided with either the top wall or if the ball has gone past the movable player brick.

      Checks whether the ball has collided with the movable player brick.
      boolean collidesVertical()
      Checks whether the ball has collided with either the left wall or the right wall.
      void dispose()
      Method called when the PlayState is removed from the GameStateManger stack to dispose/deallocate the ball image resource.
      void flipVelocityX()
      Flips the X direction of the ball movement.
      void flipVelocityY()
      Flips the Y direction of the ball movement.

      Returns a rectangle representing the boundaries of the ball.

      Returns a Vector2 representing the ball position.

      Returns the Texture class instance of the ball image.
      com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getVelocity()
      Returns a Vector2 representing the vall velocity.
      void update(float delta)
      Method that is called when the ball position changes.
